page.para: Once there was a chick/en called Dai/sy. She want/ed to fly like a bird.
The oth/er chick/ens laughed at Dai/sy. They said chick/ens canâ€™t fly.
All day long, Dai/sy dreamed of fly/ing. She want/ed to fly high in the sky.
Day after day, Dai/sy flapped her wings. She tried to fly to the roof of the shed.
Dai/sy flapped and flapped her wings. But she could not fly!
Dai/sy was sad. May/be the oth/er chick/ens were right.
Dai/sy told her mum she could not fly. But her mum told her to keep try/ing.
So Dai/sy tried a/gain. And a/gain. She flapped and flapped her wings.
She tried and tried. And eve/ry day, she got a lit/tle high/er.
Then one day, Dai/sy flew up in/to the sky. Far a/bove the shed. A/maz/ing!
